Read the following passage and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the passage:
Fish population is in serious danger from global warming. Climate change is increasing the water temperature in rivers, lakes and seas. This means there is less food and oxygen available for fish. It also means the fish may not grow fully and may have fewer offsprings. Some fishes will become extinct if temperatures rise even by one or two degrees celsius.
Climate change increases the pressure on fish population. Fishes are one of the world's most valuable biological assets. Forty percent of people in the world eat fish as their main source of protein. If we fail to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, we will increase the pressure on fish. As a result, people who depend on fish will suffer from hunger and poverty.

Question:
It is (a) — from the passage that global warming is (b) — great threat for fish population. (c) — global warming, food production and oxygen (d) — in water decrease. As a result, some fishes may be extinct (e) ——.

Louis Pasteur was a French chemist and microbiologist. He is remembered for his remarkable discoveries about the causes and prevention of diseases. He was born on December 27, 1822, in Dole, Jura, France. Pasteur entered primary. school in 1831. In 1838, he went to Paris to attend the Pension Barbet but became homesick and returned home. In 1839, he enrolled at the College Royal de Besançon and received his, Bachelor of Letters (BL) degree in 1840. He earned a Bachelor of Science (BSc) in Mathematics from Dijon in 1842. Pasteur obtained his license to teach science in 1845. He was appointed professor of physics at the College de Tournon in 1846. He developed the rabies vaccine in 1885. Pasteur died on September 28, 1895 , at the age of 72.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage is about Louis Pasteur, the inventor of the vaccines for Rabies. He was both a chemist and  a microbiologist. He was a citizen of France and was born in 1822. After completing his formal education, he received medical license in 1845. He became a physics professor the following year. This great man died in 1895.

Long ago, in the realm of England, there lived a mighty king named Lear. Yearning to divide his vast kingdom among his three daughters, he sought to ascertain the depth of their love. Addressing his eldest daughter, Lear inquired, "How much do you love me?" The eldest daughter, with a fervent expression, declared, "Sir, I love you more than words can express." Pleased by her response, Lear bestowed upon her a third of his kingdom. Turning to his second daughter, he posed the same question. The second daughter, with unwavering devotion, replied, "My love for you is eternal." Gratified by her answer, Lear granted her another third of his kingdom. Finally, he approached his youngest daughter, eager to hear her declaration of love. To Lear's astonishment, the youngest daughter responded simply, "Nothing." Shocked by her unexpected reply, Lear exclaimed, "Nothing will come of nothing."

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph about pastimes.
(a) What do you enjoy doing in your free time? Think about activities that you find relaxing, fun, or interesting.
(b) Can you name some different types of pastimes? Consider hobbies, sports, arts, or other activities.
(c) Which pastimes do you prefer the most? Why do you enjoy these activities?
(d) Do you enjoy spending time alone or with others when you pursue your pastimes? Explain your preference.
(e) How have your pastimes changed or remained the same in recent years? What factors have influenced these changes?

sub_questions.explanation: In today's fast-paced world, finding moments of leisure is essential for maintaining a balanced and fulfilling life. Personally, I enjoy engaging in a variety of activities that I find relaxing and fun in my free time. Some of my favorite pastimes include reading books, painting, and playing indoor games. I particularly enjoy reading the most because it allows me to see different worlds and learn new things. Painting is another hobby I cherish as it lets me bring out my latent creativity. I enjoy playing chess since I find it a brain-game. I also like playing badminton in winter because it has not only fun but also helps me stay active and healthy. I prefer spending my free time with friends and family as it makes the activities more enjoyable and creates cherished memories. However, I enjoy reading, cooking and painting doing alone. Sometimes I like being alone in my free time and sometimes I enjoy others' company. Over the years, my pastimes have evolved. I have recently developed an interest in cooking and gardening as well. Cooking is also a kind of art to me. These new hobbies have been influenced by my growing desire to lead a healthier lifestyle and spend more time outdoors. Overall, my pastimes continue to bring joy and balance to my life.

questions.uddipok: Imagine, you are Rupak from 17 Broad Lane, Chattogram. Your friend, Hasan, who lives at 15 Minto Road, Dhaka, has developed an addiction to smoking cigarettes. Write an email to Hasa, detailing the dangers of smoking cigarettes.

sub_questions.explanation:
Dear Hasan,
I hope this email finds you in good health and spirits. It’s been a while since we last met, and I often think about the wonderful times we’ve shared. However, I recently heard about your habit of smoking cigarettes, and I felt it was important to reach out to you.
Hasan, I understand that smoking may seem harmless at first, but it poses significant risks to your health. Cigarette smoke contains harmful chemicals like nicotine, tar, and carbon monoxide, which can damage your lungs and heart over time. Prolonged smoking increases the chances of developing life-threatening illnesses such as lung cancer, heart disease, and respiratory disorders.
Moreover, smoking doesn’t just harm you; it can also affect those around you. Second-hand smoke can be equally harmful to your family and friends, especially children and the elderly.
I know breaking a habit like this is challenging, but with determination and the right support, you can do it. There are many effective methods to quit smoking, such as counseling, nicotine replacement therapy, or even joining a support group. Please take a step towards a healthier life.
Your well-being matters to me, and I hope you will seriously consider this. Let’s meet soon—I’m always here to support you through any difficulty.
Take care and stay safe.
Warm regards, Rupak 17 Broad Lane Chattogram

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Shakir/Shakira and your friend is Talha/Tania.. Your friend does not get up early in the morning. For this reason he/she faces many problems. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the importance of early rising.

sub_questions.explanation:
Shakir: Hey Talha! You look really tired today. What’s up?
Talha: Ugh, I didn’t sleep well. I went to bed late and couldn’t get up early in the morning.
Shakir: That’s not good, man. You’ve been struggling with waking up late for a while now, haven’t you?
Talha: Yeah, and it’s causing so many problems. I miss breakfast, get late for school, and feel lazy all day.
Shakir: That’s exactly why early rising is important! It gives you a fresh start and enough time to plan your day properly.
Talha: I know, but I just can't seem to leave my bed in the morning!
Shakir: Try going to bed earlier. Trust me, waking up early makes you feel more energetic and focused. Plus, you can enjoy the peaceful morning atmosphere.
Talha: Hmm, that actually sounds nice. Do you wake up early every day?
Shakir: I try to. I go for a short walk, enjoy the fresh air, and it really helps me concentrate better in class.
Talha: Alright, I’ll give it a try. Maybe I’ll set an alarm for 6 AM tomorrow!
Shakir: That’s the spirit! Start with small steps. You’ll notice the change soon.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions:
a) What motivated Mr Islam to remain in his village instead of pursuing a career in the city?
b) How do the values of the Islam family reflect their dedication to their community?
c) In what ways does Mr Islam find contentment in his village life?
d) What can be inferred about the impact of education on the choices made by the Islam brothers?
e) What message do the Islam brothers convey about the relationship between one's roots and professional aspirations?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) The sense of obligation to his village motivated Mr Islam to remain in that place instead of pursuing a career in the city. He wanted to work as a farmer, live with his family, and be close to his roots.
(b) To Mr Islam and his brothers, the purpose of education is not only to pursue office jobs but also to contribute to their community. Despite being highly educated, the Islam brothers did not run after a conventional career like most people. Instead, they remained in their village and chose work that aligned with their academic background.
(c) Mr Islam finds contentment in his village life through simple yet meaningful activities such as working on his own farm, resting in his own house, spending time with his family and reconnecting with old friends.
(d) It can be inferred that education helped Islam brothers understand the significance of one's obligation towards his/her community. Realizing this obligation, they contributed actively to their community from their respective fields.
(e) The Islam brothers convey an inspiring message about the relationship between one's roots and professional aspirations. They believe that the role of education goes beyond personal gain and it should also serve the community. As sons and daughters of the soil, it is our responsibility to utilize our learnings for the betterment of our roots.
